page.title: 01THE RURAL AREA OF SHALBOURNE
page.content: Shalbourne is the only complete village in the area. A{linear village, it is in a loop road{off}the SE side of the{Oxford-Salisbury road,}just inside Wiltshire. The land around is mostly agricultural, six farms sharing the acreage, growing cereals, rape, beans, etc. There are some large blocks of mainly deciduous woodland. Bedwyn railway and the canal are just in the NW corner of the block. The {character}of Shalbourne has{changed considerably in the last half century {from}being entirely{agricultural}with ancillary trades to being mostly a {dormitory area}for people working in nearby towns and a quiet place for retired professional people. Some houses are used for weekends/holidays only, doing little to help the running of the village or supporting the post office cum grocer's shop.
